text: What are the viable database abstraction layers for Python
I'm starting to get involved in an open source project Gramps which is exploring switching their backend from BSDDB to a relational database.
Either SQLite or MySQL we haven't fully decided and may even try to do both in some limited capacity.
I'm a professional developer but I'm new to python so I'm not that familiar with the current selection of tools/libraries.
I've been tasked with researching DB Abstraction Layers.
There is currently a wiki discussion going on to compare them.
An object relational mapper might be nice but isn't absolutely necessary.
though I know that is usually synonymous with a DB Abstraction Layer.
If an ORM is included ad hock queries have to be available without to much wrestling.
